original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"He will take these weak mortal bodies of ours and change

them into glorious bodies like His own, using the same mighty

power that He will use to conquer everything, everywhere."

(Phil. 3:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The phrase "weak mortal bodies" does not imply any negative

attitude toward the human body. However the bodies we will

receive when we are raised from the dead, will be glorious like

Christ's resurrected body. Those who have struggled with illness

will have a wonderful hope at the resurrection.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for The promise of a new body, which

will no longer suffer any pain. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The phrase "weak mortal bodies" does not imply any negative attitude toward the human body. However the bodies we will receive when we are raised from the dead, will be glorious like Christ's resurrected body. Those who have struggled with illness will have a wonderful hope at the resurrection.
original_verse_text: "He will take these weak mortal bodies of ours and change them into glorious bodies like His own, using the same mighty power that He will use to conquer everything, everywhere. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the promise of the Resurrection and the transformation of our weak mortal bodies into glorious, imperishable forms like that of our Savior, Jesus Christ. We eagerly await the redemption of our bodies, longing for the day when we will be freed from the struggles and sufferings of this world. Lord, strengthen our hope and fill us with joy as we anticipate the day when we will be raised to new life in Your eternal kingdom. Amen.
reflection: The phrase "weak mortal bodies" does not imply any negative attitude toward the human body. However, the bodies we will receive when we are raised from the dead will be glorious like Christ's resurrected body. Those who have struggled with illness will have a wonderful hope at the resurrection.
subject: Glorious Resurrected Bodies Await
verse_text: "He will take these weak mortal bodies of ours and change them into glorious bodies like His own, using the same mighty power that He will use to conquer everything, everywhere. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Always be full of joy in the Lord, I say it again, rejoice.

(Phil. 4:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Ultimate joy comes from Christ dwelling within us.

Christ is near, and at His second coming we will fully

realize this ultimate joy. He who lives within us will

fulfill His final purpose.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, it goes without saying that my joy will be

complete at Your second coming. I wait for the fulfillment

of your final purpose. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Ultimate joy comes from Christ dwelling within us. Christ is near, and at His second coming we will fully realize this ultimate joy. He who lives within us will fulfill His final purpose.
original_verse_text: "Always be full of joy in the Lord, I say it again, rejoice.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we rejoice in the truth that our citizenship is in heaven, where our Lord Jesus Christ reigns. Fill us with the joy of knowing that He dwells within us, and that at His glorious return, our lowly bodies will be transformed to be like His resplendent form. May we eagerly await this day, when we shall see You face to face and experience the fullness of joy forevermore. Amen.
reflection: Ultimate joy comes from Christ dwelling within us. Christ is near, and at His second coming we will fully realize this ultimate joy. He who lives within us will fulfill His final purpose.
subject: Realize Ultimate Joy in Christ
verse_text: "Always be full of joy in the Lord, I say it again, rejoice.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Let everyone see that you are considerate in all that you do. 

Remember the Lord is coming soon. (Phil. 4:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are to be reasonable, fair minded, and charitable, to those

who are not followers of Christ, and not just to believers. This

means we are not to seek revenge against those who treat us

unfairly, nor are we to be overly vocal about our personal rights.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I am not as

considerate as I should be. I pray that Your Holy Spirit

would guide me in a life more charitable to those who

need to be aware of a Christ like love of believers. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are to be reasonable, fair minded, and charitable, to those who are not followers of Christ, and not just to believers. This means we are not to seek revenge against those who treat us unfairly, nor are we to be overly vocal about our personal rights.
original_verse_text: "Let everyone see that you are considerate in all that you do. Remember the Lord is coming soon.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to reflect Your love and grace to all people, even those who may not share our faith. Help us to be reasonable, fair-minded, and charitable, as Your Word instructs, not seeking revenge but rather pursuing peace. May our lives be a testament to Your transformative power, that others may see Your light shining through us. We trust in Your wisdom and guidance, Lord. Amen.
reflection: We are to be reasonable, fair-minded, and charitable to those who are not followers of Christ, and not just to believers. This means we are not to seek revenge against those who treat us unfairly, nor are we to be overly vocal about our personal rights.
subject: Respond with Reason, Not Revenge
verse_text: "Let everyone see that you are considerate in all that you do. Remember the Lord is coming soon.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Don't worry about anything, instead, pray about everything.

Tell God what you need, and thank Him for all He has done.

(Phil 4:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Can you imagine never worrying about anything? It seems

like an impossibility, we all have worries about one thing

or another. But Paul's advice is to turn worries into prayers.

What we should take from Paul's advice is, we need to

pray more - - So let us always remember, when we start to

worry, stop and pray.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me for worrying needlessly when I

have You to turn to by the avenue of prayer. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Can you imagine never worrying about anything? It seems like an impossibility, we all have worries about one thing or another. But Paul's advice is to turn worries into prayers. What we should take from Paul's advice is, we need to pray more - - So let us always remember, when we start to worry, stop and pray.
original_verse_text: "Don't worry about anything, instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank Him for all He has done.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are the source of all peace and comfort. As Your Word in Philippians 4:6 instructs, we bring our anxieties and concerns to You in prayer, trusting that You will provide for our every need. Help us to rejoice in hope, be patient in tribulation, and persevere in prayer, as Romans 12:12 encourages. May we cast our cares upon You, knowing that You care for us. Amen.
reflection: Can you imagine never worrying about anything? It seems like an impossibility; we all have worries about one thing or another. But Paul's advice is to turn worries into prayers. What we should take from Paul's advice is that we need to pray more. So let us always remember, when we start to worry, stop and pray.
subject: Worry-Free Living Through Prayer
verse_text: "Don't worry about anything, instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank Him for all He has done.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Keep putting into practice all you learned from me and

heard from me and saw me doing, and the God of peace

will be with you.

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is not enough to hear or read the Word of God or even

know it well. We must also put it into practice.How easy

it is to hear a sermon and forget what the preacher said.

How easy it is to read the Bible and not think about how

to live differently.Exposer to God's Word it is not enough.

It must lead to obedience.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive to

Your Holy Spirit's leading so that I would put into practice

what I have heard and read in Your Word. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is not enough to hear or read the Word of God or even know it well. We must also put it into practice. How easy it is to hear a sermon and forget what the preacher said. How easy it is to read the Bible and not think about how to live differently. Expose to God's Word it is not enough. It must lead to obedience.
original_verse_text: Keep putting into practice all you learned from me and heard from me and saw me doing, and the God of peace will be with you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Word, which instructs and guides us in the way we should go. Help us not merely to hear or read Your truth, but to put it into practice, living as the workmanship You have created in Christ Jesus for good works. May our lives be a reflection of Your will, that we may walk in the path You have prepared for us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: It is not enough to hear or read the Word of God or even know it well. We must also put it into practice. How easy it is to hear a sermon and forget what the preacher said. How easy it is to read the Bible and not think about how to live differently. Exposure to God's Word is not enough. It must lead to obedience.
subject: Obedience to God's Word
verse_text: Keep putting into practice all you learned from me and heard from me and saw me doing, and the God of peace will be with you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY: (Paul's letter of appreciation)

"How grateful I am, and how I praise the Lord that you are 

concerned about me again. I know that you have always 

been concerned for me, but for a while you didn't have the

chance to help me." (Phil. 4:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to rely on God's promises and Christ's power for

strength. If we always want more, we need to ask God to

remove that desire and teach us contentment in every

circumstance. He will supply all our needs, but in a way

that He knows is best for us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord help me to be content in what I have, please

forgive me for the urge to want more, when I know that

You have promised to supply all our needs. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We need to rely on God's promises and Christ's power for strength. If we always want more, we need to ask God to remove that desire and teach us contentment in every circumstance. He will supply all our needs, but in a way that He knows is best for us.
original_verse_text: (Paul's letter of appreciation) "How grateful I am, and how I praise the Lord that you are concerned about me again. I know that you have always been concerned for me, but for a while you didn't have the chance to help me. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our true strength and contentment come from You alone. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding, but to submit to Your perfect will for our lives. May You guide our paths and provide for our needs according to Your riches in glory in Christ Jesus. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: We need to rely on God's promises and Christ's power for strength. If we always want more, we need to ask God to remove that desire and teach us contentment in every circumstance. He will supply all our needs, but in a way that He knows is best for us.
subject: Contentment in Every Circumstance
verse_text: (Paul's letter of appreciation) "How grateful I am, and how I praise the Lord that you are concerned about me again. I know that you have always been concerned for me, but for a while you didn't have the chance to help me. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"I can do everything with the help of Christ who gives

me the strength I need." (Phil. 4:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Can we really do everything? The power we receive in union

with Christ is sufficient to do His will and to face the challenges

that arise from our commitment to do it. As we content for the

faith, we will face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they come,

ask Christ to strengthen you.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that I often find myself

struggling with the issues of this life, because I have forgotten

to ask Christ to strengthen me for the task at hand. Forgive me

Lord. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Can we really do everything? The power we receive in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will and to face the challenges that arise from our commitment to do it. As we content for the faith, we will face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they come, ask Christ to strengthen you.
original_verse_text: "I can do everything with the help of Christ who gives me the strength I need. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that in Christ, we can do all things through Your strength and power. As we face the trials and tribulations of this world, we ask that You would equip us with the courage and perseverance to stand firm in our faith. May we find our sufficiency in You, Lord, for if You are for us, who can be against us? We trust in Your unfailing love and the assurance that You have not spared even Your own Son, but have given Him up for us all. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Can we really do everything? The power we receive in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will and to face the challenges that arise from our commitment to do it. As we contend for the faith, we will face troubles, pressures, and trials. As they come, ask Christ to strengthen you.
subject: Strength for the Journey
verse_text: "I can do everything with the help of Christ who gives me the strength I need. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"When I was in Thessalonica you sent help more then once.

What I want is for you to receive a well-earned reward

because of your kindness. (Phil. 4:16-17b)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we give to those in need, it not only benefits the

receiver but it benefits us as well. It was not the

Philippians' gift but their spirit of love and devotion that

Paul appreciated most.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, of grace and mercy, I thank You for all You

have done for me, I pray that I would always be mindful

of those who are in need, where I maybe of help. Amen.
original_reflection_text: When we give to those in need, it not only benefits the receiver but it benefits us as well. It was not the Philippians' gift but their spirit of love and devotion that Paul appreciated most.
original_verse_text: "When I was in Thessalonian you sent help more then once. What I want is for you to receive a well-earned reward because of your kindness.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your hand. Help us to give cheerfully, not out of obligation, but out of a spirit of love and devotion to You. May our generosity reflect the abundance of Your blessings, and may it be a testimony to the world of Your compassion and care for those in need. We ask that You would use our offerings to further Your kingdom and bring glory to Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: When we give to those in need, it not only benefits the receiver, but it benefits us as well. It was not the Philippians' gift, but their spirit of love and devotion that Paul appreciated most.
subject: Giving Blesses the Giver
verse_text: "When I was in Thessalonian you sent help more then once. What I want is for you to receive a well-earned reward because of your kindness.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"The purpose for these Proverbs is to teach people wisdom, 

and discipline, and to help them understand wise sayings." 

(Proverbs: 1:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A Proverb is a short, wise, easy-to-remember saying that calls

a person to action. It doesn't argue about basic spiritual and

moral beliefs, it assumes we already know them. The book of

Proverbs focuses on God, His character, works, and blessings,

and it tells how we can live in closer relationship to Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray as I study these Proverbs I will grow in wisdom

disciple and understanding. I also pray that I would also grow

closer to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A Proverb is a short, wise, easy-to-remember saying that calls a person to action. It doesn't argue about basic spiritual and moral beliefs, it assumes we already know them. The book of Proverbs focuses on God, His character, works, and blessings, and it tells how we can live in closer relationship to Him.
original_verse_text: The purpose for these Proverbs is to teach people wisdom, and discipline, and to help them understand wise sayings.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your infinite wisdom and the treasures found in Your Word. As we meditate on the Proverbs, grant us the discernment to understand Your ways and the courage to trust in You with all our hearts. Guide our steps, that we may walk in the path of righteousness, ever seeking to know You more deeply and to live according to Your perfect will. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: A proverb is a short, wise, easy-to-remember saying that calls a person to action. It doesn't argue about basic spiritual and moral beliefs; it assumes we already know them. The Book of Proverbs focuses on God, His character, works, and blessings, and it tells how we can live in closer relationship to Him.
subject: Wisdom for Daily Living
verse_text: The purpose for these Proverbs is to teach people wisdom, and discipline, and to help them understand wise sayings.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge.

Only fools despise wisdom and discipline."  (Pro. 1:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the age of information, knowledge is plentiful, But

wisdom is scarce. Wisdom means far more than knowing

a lot. It is a basic attitude that affects every aspect of

life. The foundation of knowledge is knowing the Lord.

Trust in the God, he will make you truly wise.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the teaching of Your Word.

I pray that I would continue to grow in wisdom

and love for my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In the age of information, knowledge is plentiful, But wisdom is scarce. Wisdom means far more than knowing a lot. It is a basic attitude that affects every aspect of life. The foundation of knowledge is knowing the Lord. Trust in the God, he will make you truly wise.
original_verse_text: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge. Only fools despise wisdom and discipline. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that true wisdom comes not from the abundance of knowledge, but from knowing and trusting in You. Grant us the humility to seek Your guidance, that we may walk in the path of understanding and discernment. Instill in us a reverent fear of the Lord, for this is the beginning of wisdom. May Your wisdom be the foundation upon which we build our lives, that we may live with purpose and glorify Your name. Amen.
reflection: In the age of information, knowledge is plentiful, but wisdom is scarce. Wisdom means far more than knowing a lot. It is a basic attitude that affects every aspect of life. The foundation of knowledge is knowing the Lord. Trust in the Lord, he will make you truly wise.
subject: Cultivate Godly Wisdom for Life
verse_text: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge. Only fools despise wisdom and discipline. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Listen, my child, to what your Father teaches you.

Don't neglect your mother's teaching." (Prov. 1:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our actions speak louder than words. This is especially true

in the home. Children learn values, morals, and priorities by

observing how their parents act and react every day. If parents

exhibit a deep reverence for and dependence upon God, the

children will catch these attitudes

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I understand the importance of being

a good example to my children and grand children, I pray

that I will always exhibit a dependence upon you so minors

will follow my example. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our actions speak louder than words. This is especially true in the home. Children learn values, morals, and priorities by observing how their parents act and react every day. If parents exhibit a deep reverence for and dependence upon God, the children will catch these attitudes
original_verse_text: "Listen, my child, to what your Father teaches you. Don't neglect your mother's teaching. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the great responsibility You have entrusted to us as parents. Help us to be faithful examples, modeling a life of obedience and devotion to You. Grant us wisdom to instruct our children in Your ways, that they may grow in the knowledge and love of You. May our actions and attitudes reflect Your love, grace, and truth, so that our children may learn to walk in Your paths. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Our actions speak louder than words. This is especially true in the home. Children learn values, morals, and priorities by observing how their parents act and react every day. If parents exhibit a deep reverence for and dependence upon God, the children will catch these attitudes.
subject: Cultivating Godly Influence at Home
verse_text: "Listen, my child, to what your Father teaches you. Don't neglect your mother's teaching. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"My child, if sinners entice you, turn your back on them."

(Pro. 1:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sin is enticing because it offers a quick route to prosperity

and makes us feel like one of the crowd. But when we go

along with others and refuse to listen to the truth, our own

appetites become our masters, and we will do anything to

satisfy them. Sin even when attractive, is deadly.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Unless you live in a cocoon, you will be enticed by one

sin or another. In order to overcome any sin, you need to

call on the Master for the strength to over come every sin.
original_reflection_text: Sin is enticing because it offers a quick route to prosperity and makes us feel like one of the crowd. But when we go along with others and refuse to listen to the truth, our own appetites become our masters, and we will do anything to satisfy them. Sin even when attractive, is deadly.
original_verse_text: "My child, if sinners entice you, turn your back on them. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the temptation of sin and the allure of the crowd. Help us to resist the urge to follow the wicked and to turn away from the path of the unrighteous. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to walk in the way of understanding, for we know that the way of the wicked is dark and leads to destruction. May we ever heed Your call to avoid it, and instead, seek the life-giving path of righteousness. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Sin is enticing because it offers a quick route to prosperity and makes us feel like one of the crowd. But when we go along with others and refuse to listen to the truth, our own appetites become our masters, and we will do anything to satisfy them. Sin, even when attractive, is deadly.
subject: Deadly Allure of Sin
verse_text: "My child, if sinners entice you, turn your back on them. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

The Lord invites us: "Come here and listen to me! I will 

pour out the Spirit of wisdom and make you wise." (Pro. 1:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God is more then willing to pour out His heart and make

known His thoughts to us. To receive His advice, we must

be willing to listen, refusing to let pride stand in our way.

Pride is thinking more highly of our own wisdom and

desires then God's. If we think we know better then God

or feel we have no need of God's direction, we have fallen

into foolish and disastrous pride.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive to Your

invitation. I pray that You would remove from me all foolish

pride. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God is more then willing to pour out His heart and make known His thoughts to us. To receive His advice, we must be willing to listen, refusing to let pride stand in our way. Pride is thinking more highly of our own wisdom and desires then God's. If we think we know better then God or feel we have no need of God's direction, we have fallen into foolish and disastrous pride.
original_verse_text: The Lord invites us: "Come here and listen to me! I will pour out the Spirit of wisdom and make you wise. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our wisdom is limited and our understanding is flawed. Forgive us for the times we have trusted in our own understanding, rather than seeking Your divine guidance. Lord, we pray that You would pour out Your wisdom upon us, that we may walk in Your ways and not lean on our own understanding. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, that You may direct our paths according to Your perfect will. May we ever be willing to receive Your counsel and follow where You lead. Amen.
reflection: God is more than willing to pour out His heart and make known His thoughts to us. To receive His advice, we must be willing to listen, refusing to let pride stand in our way. Pride is thinking more highly of our own wisdom and desires than God's. If we think we know better than God or feel we have no need of God's direction, we have fallen into foolish and disastrous pride.
subject: Overcome Prideful Thinking; Seek God's Wisdom
verse_text: The Lord invites us: "Come here and listen to me! I will pour out the Spirit of wisdom and make you wise. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Cry out for insight and understanding. Search for them

as you would lost money or hidden treasure." (Pro. 2:3-4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wisdom comes in two ways. It is a God given gift and also

the result or an energetic search. Wisdom's starting point is

God and His revealed Word, The source of "knowledge and

understanding." In that sense it is His gift to us. But He gives

it only to those who earnestly seek it.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father I pray that I would never cease to

earnestly seek wisdom and the knowledge of Your Word.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wisdom comes in two ways. It is a God given gift and also the result or an energetic search. Wisdom's starting point is God and His revealed Word, The source of "knowledge and understanding. " In that sense it is His gift to us. But He gives it only to those who earnestly seek it.
original_verse_text: "Cry out for insight and understanding. Search for them as you would lost money or hidden treasure. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the wisdom that You so graciously offer. Help us to not merely seek knowledge, but to earnestly search for the understanding that comes from Your Word. May we find the treasure of Your wisdom, more precious than silver or gold, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Grant us the diligence and perseverance to pursue this gift, that we may be filled with the knowledge and understanding that comes from You alone. Amen.
reflection: Wisdom comes in two ways. It is a God given gift and also the result or an energetic search. Wisdom's starting point is God and His revealed Word, The source of "knowledge and understanding. " In that sense it is His gift to us. But He gives it only to those who earnestly seek it.
subject: Seek Wisdom, God's Gift
verse_text: "Cry out for insight and understanding. Search for them as you would lost money or hidden treasure. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"For the Lord grants wisdom! From His mouth comes 

knowledge and understanding." (Pro. 2:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God gives wisdom and victory, to the godly, but not to those

drifting through life or acting irresponsibly with his gifts and

resources. If we are faithful to Him and keep our purpose in

life clearly in mind, He will keep us from pride and greed.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be sensitive

and obedient to Your Holy Spirit, so that I would grow in

knowledge, understanding and faithfulness. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God gives wisdom and victory, to the godly, but not to those drifting through life or acting irresponsibly with his gifts and resources. If we are faithful to Him and keep our purpose in life clearly in mind, He will keep us from pride and greed.
original_verse_text: "For the Lord grants wisdom! From His mouth comes knowledge and understanding. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that all wisdom and understanding come from You alone. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not rely on our own understanding. Guide our steps, that we may walk in Your ways and not drift from Your purpose for our lives. Keep us from the temptations of pride and greed, that we may faithfully steward the gifts and resources You have entrusted to us. May we ever seek Your will and find victory in Your perfect plan. Amen.
reflection: God gives wisdom and victory to the godly, but not to those drifting through life or acting irresponsibly with His gifts and resources. If we are faithful to Him and keep our purpose in life clearly in mind, He will keep us from pride and greed.
subject: Wisdom and Victory for the Godly
verse_text: "For the Lord grants wisdom! From His mouth comes knowledge and understanding. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will fill

you with joy." (Pro. 2:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We gain wisdom through a constant process of growing.

FIRST, we must trust and honor God. SECOND, we must

realize, that the Bible reveals Gods wisdom to us. THIRD,

we must make a life-long series of right choices and avoid

moral pitfalls. FOURTH, when we make sinful choices or

mistakes, we must learn from our errors and recover. We

can pray for all aspects of wisdom and take the steps to

develop them in our life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess I have made many

mistakes in my life. Now I pray that I have learned from

them a lesson which will place me on a path You would

have me to be. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We gain wisdom through a constant process of growing. FIRST, we must trust and honor God. SECOND, we must realize, that the Bible reveals Gods wisdom to us. THIRD, we must make a lifelong series of right choices and avoid moral pitfalls. FOURTH, when we make sinful choices or mistakes, we must learn from our errors and recover. We can pray for all aspects of wisdom and take the steps to develop them in our life.
original_verse_text: "Wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will fill you with joy. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the wisdom that You so graciously offer. Help us to trust in You and honor Your ways, that we may grow in understanding and discernment. Guide us as we study Your Word, that it may take root in our hearts and bear the fruit of righteous living. When we stumble, grant us the humility to learn from our mistakes and the strength to make better choices. May the pursuit of Your wisdom be the driving force in our lives, for it is more precious than silver or gold. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: We gain wisdom through a constant process of growing. First, we must trust and honor God. Second, we must realize that the Bible reveals God's wisdom to us. Third, we must make a lifelong series of right choices and avoid moral pitfalls. Fourth, when we make sinful choices or mistakes, we must learn from our errors and recover. We can pray for all aspects of wisdom and take the steps to develop them in our life.
subject: Gain Wisdom Through Lifelong Growth
verse_text: "Wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will fill you with joy. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Only the upright will live in the land, and those 

who have integrity will remain in it." (Pro. 2:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The godly know right from wrong, they fill their

hearts with God's law, so they will not slip from

God's path. The Lord will not let the wicked succeed,

or let the godly be condemned when they are brought

before the judge.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of all grace and mercy, I pray again today

for a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirits guidance. I

pray that I will never stray for Your path. , Amen.
original_reflection_text: The godly know right from wrong, they fill their hearts with God's law, so they will not slip from God's path. The Lord will not let the wicked succeed, or let the godly be condemned when they are brought before the judge.
original_verse_text: "Only the upright will live in the land, and those who have integrity will remain in it. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom and discernment found in Your Word. Help us to walk in the way of the righteous, filling our hearts with Your law and keeping us firmly on the path of righteousness. May the wicked not prevail, and may the godly find favor in Your sight. Guide us, Lord, that we may honor You in all we do. Amen.
reflection: The godly know right from wrong. They fill their hearts with God's law, so they will not slip from God's path. The Lord will not let the wicked succeed or let the godly be condemned when they are brought before the judge.
subject: Godly Discern Right from Wrong
verse_text: "Only the upright will live in the land, and those who have integrity will remain in it. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"My child, never forget the things I have taught you,

Store My commandment in your heart. For they will 

give you long and satisfying life. (Pro. 3:1-2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Gen. 20:6, God says, He will lavish His love on

those who love Him and obey His commandments.

So, it is very important that we allow God to ho;d

a central place in our lives.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord, I have to confess that I have broken more

then one commandment each day of which I ask

Your forgiveness. I pray for Your Spirit's guidance

so that I would keep You in first place in my life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In Genesis 20:6, God says, He will lavish His love on those who love Him and obey His commandments. So, it is very important that we allow God to ho; d a central place in our lives.
original_verse_text: "My child, never forget the things I have taught you, Store My commandment in your heart. For they will give you long and satisfying life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your rightful place as the one true God. Help us to love You with all our heart, soul, and strength, as Your Word instructs. May we treasure Your commandments and walk in Your ways, that we may experience the fullness of Your blessings and the lavish outpouring of Your love. Guide us to keep Your precepts at the forefront of our lives, that we may live in a manner that is pleasing to You. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: In Genesis 20:6, God says, He will lavish His love on those who love Him and obey His commandments. So, it is very important that we allow God to ho; d a central place in our lives.
subject: Embrace God's Lavish Love
verse_text: "My child, never forget the things I have taught you, Store My commandment in your heart. For they will give you long and satisfying life.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Never let loyalty and kindness get away from you! 

Wear them like a necklace, write them deep within 

your heart." (Pro. 3:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Loyalty and kindness are important character qualities

Both involve actions as well as attitudes. A loyal person

acts responsibility. A kind person works for justice for

others. Thoughts and words are not enough---our life

reveals whether we are truly loyal and kind. Do your

actions measure up to your attitude. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that My loyalty to You and my kindness

to others would always be genuine in Your sight and in the

sight of others. I pray that my attitude would always measure

up to Your will. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Loyalty and kindness are important character qualities Both involve actions as well as attitudes. A loyal person acts responsibility. A kind person works for justice for others. Thoughts and words are not enough---our life reveals whether we are truly loyal and kind. Do your actions measure up to your attitude. .
original_verse_text: "Never let loyalty and kindness get away from you! Wear them like a necklace, write them deep within your heart. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to live out the virtues of loyalty and kindness that You have called us to. Help us to not only speak of these qualities, but to embody them in our daily lives. May our actions and attitudes reflect Your love and compassion, as we strive to treat others with the same grace and forgiveness that You have shown us. Guide us, Lord, to be responsible and just, that we may be a light to the world. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Loyalty and kindness are important character qualities Both involve actions as well as attitudes. A loyal person acts responsibility. A kind person works for justice for others. Thoughts and words are not enough---our life reveals whether we are truly loyal and kind. Do your actions measure up to your attitude. .
subject: Loyal and Kind Character Matters
verse_text: "Never let loyalty and kindness get away from you! Wear them like a necklace, write them deep within your heart. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the best

part of everything our land produces." (Pro. 3:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many people give God their left-overs. If they can

afford to donate anything after the bills are paid, they

do so. These people may be sincere and contribute

willingly, but they are not obeying what God says.

God wants the first part of our income.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, You gave of Your best, Your

Son for me. May I always give You my best. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Many people give God their leftovers. If they can afford to donate anything after the bills are paid, they do so. These people may be sincere and contribute willingly, but they are not obeying what God says. God wants the first part of our income.
original_verse_text: "Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the best part of everything our land produces. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we have is a gift from Your gracious hand. Help us to honor You with the firstfruits of our labor, not the leftovers. May we joyfully give the best of what You have provided, trusting that You will bless us abundantly as we seek to obey Your command. Guide us to be faithful stewards, putting You first in our finances and our lives. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Many people give God their leftovers. If they can afford to donate anything after the bills are paid, they do so. These people may be sincere and contribute willingly, but they are not obeying what God says. God wants the first part of our income.
subject: Prioritize God's Portion First
verse_text: "Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the best part of everything our land produces. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Wisdom offers you life in her right hand, and riches, and

 honor in her left in her left." 

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Proverbs contains many strong statements about the benefits

of wisdom, including long life, wealth, honor, and peace. If

you are not experiencing them, it does not mean you are short

on wisdom. Instead of guarantees, these statements are

general principals. In a perfect world, wise behavior would

always lead to these benefits.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the day when You bring

into being the New Heaven and the New Earth, where this

will become a perfect world. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Proverbs contains many strong statements about the benefits of wisdom, including long life, wealth, honor, and peace. If you are not experiencing them, it does not mean you are short on wisdom. Instead of guarantees, these statements are general principals. In a perfect world, wise behavior would always lead to these benefits.
original_verse_text: Wisdom offers you life in her right hand, and riches, and honor in her left in her left.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true wisdom comes from You alone. Help us to seek Your understanding and discernment, that we may walk in the path of righteousness. Grant us the wisdom to navigate the complexities of life, shielding us from the snares of the wicked and guiding us towards the blessings You have promised. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness, that we may experience the fullness of the life You have for us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Proverbs contains many strong statements about the benefits of wisdom, including long life, wealth, honor, and peace. If you are not experiencing them, it does not mean you are short on wisdom. Instead of guarantees, these statements are general principles. In a perfect world, wise behavior would always lead to these benefits.
subject: Wisdom's Promised Blessings
verse_text: Wisdom offers you life in her right hand, and riches, and honor in her left in her left.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Wisdom will guide you down delightful paths; all her

ways are satisfying."  (Pro. 3:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Even in this troubled world, living wisely usually results in

obvious blessings, but not always. sometimes sin intervenes,

and some blessing must be delayed until Jesus returns to

establish His eternal Kingdom. That is why we must "live

by believing and not by seeing" (2 Cor. 5:7). We can be sure

that wisdom ultimately leads to blessing.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive to

Your Holy Spirit's leading so that He can keep my faith

in you alive. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Even in this troubled world, living wisely usually results in obvious blessings, but not always. sometimes sin intervenes, and some blessing must be delayed until Jesus returns to establish His eternal Kingdom. That is why we must "live by believing and not by seeing" (2 Corinthians 5:7). We can be sure that wisdom ultimately leads to blessing.
original_verse_text: "Wisdom will guide you down delightful paths; all her ways are satisfying. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your ways are higher than our own. Even in the midst of life's challenges, we trust that Your wisdom leads to true and lasting blessing. Help us to live by faith, not by sight, as we await the glorious return of Your Son, Jesus, and the establishment of Your eternal kingdom. Grant us the discernment to walk in Your ways, that we may experience the peace and joy that come from living according to Your perfect plan. Amen.
reflection: Even in this troubled world, living wisely usually results in obvious blessings, but not always. sometimes sin intervenes, and some blessing must be delayed until Jesus returns to establish His eternal Kingdom. That is why we must "live by believing and not by seeing" (2 Corinthians 5:7). We can be sure that wisdom ultimately leads to blessing.
subject: Wisdom Leads to Blessing
verse_text: "Wisdom will guide you down delightful paths; all her ways are satisfying. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Wisdom is a tree of life to those who embrace her; happy are

those who hold her tightly. (Pro. 3:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are victorious by believing in Christ, preserving, remaining

faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings

great rewards.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again I pray for Your Holy Spirit's

leading and guiding. I pray that I would receive a teachable

heart, so that I would grow in godly wisdom. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are victorious by believing in Christ, preserving, remaining faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings great rewards.
original_verse_text: "Wisdom is a tree of life to those who embrace her; happy are those who hold her tightly.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have granted us the wisdom and strength to stand firm in the face of life's battles. Through Your Son, Jesus Christ, we have been equipped with the full armor of God, empowering us to resist the schemes of the evil one. May we cling to the promise that in You, we find the tree of life, a source of true and lasting joy. Guide us, Lord, to walk in Your ways, that we may be victorious and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings great rewards.
subject: Victorious Life in Christ
verse_text: "Wisdom is a tree of life to those who embrace her; happy are those who hold her tightly.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"My child, don't lose sight of good planning and insight. Hang on

to them. For they fill you with life and bring honor and respect.

(Pro. 3:21, 22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Your Bible can sit on your bookshelf and gather dust, or you can

make it a vital part of your life by regularly setting aside time to

study it. When you discover the wisdom of God's message, you

will want to apply it to your life and pass it on to your family and

and others. The Bible is not mere good reading, it's real help for

real life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would continue to be

faithful in the study of Your Word, and make it a vital

part of my life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Your Bible can sit on your bookshelf and gather dust, or you can make it a vital part of your life by regularly setting aside time to study it. When you discover the wisdom of God's message, you will want to apply it to your life and pass it on to your family and others. The Bible is not mere good reading, it's real help for real life.
original_verse_text: "My child, don't lose sight of good planning and insight. Hang on to them. For they fill you with life and bring honor and respect.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious gift of Your Word, which is a lamp to our feet and a light to our path. Help us to not merely read the Scriptures, but to meditate on them and apply their wisdom to our daily lives. May we find in Your Word the guidance and understanding we need to navigate the complexities of this world. Grant us the discernment to pass on this timeless wisdom to our loved ones, that they too may find the peace and joy that comes from walking in Your ways. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Your Bible can sit on your bookshelf and gather dust, or you can make it a vital part of your life by regularly setting aside time to study it. When you discover the wisdom of God's message, you will want to apply it to your life and pass it on to your family and others. The Bible is not mere good reading, it's real help for real life.
subject: Discover the Wisdom of God's Word
verse_text: "My child, don't lose sight of good planning and insight. Hang on to them. For they fill you with life and bring honor and respect.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Do not plot against your neighbor, for they trust you.

Don't make accusations against someone who hasn't

wronged you." (Pro. 3:29, 30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verse summarize the core of Christian living.

If we love someone the way Christ loves us, we will

be willing to forgive. If we have experienced God's

grace, we will want to pass it on to others.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would never betray

my neighbor's trust. I also pray that I would not make

any accusations against someone who hasn't wrong me.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: These verse summarize the core of Christian living. If we love someone the way Christ loves us, we will be willing to forgive. If we have experienced God's grace, we will want to pass it on to others.
original_verse_text: "Do not plot against your neighbor, for they trust you. Don't make accusations against someone who hasn't wronged you. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have shown us the true meaning of love and forgiveness. Help us to walk in the footsteps of Your Son, Jesus, who freely forgave those who wronged Him. Grant us the wisdom and strength to let go of any bitterness or malice, and instead, to extend the same grace and compassion that You have so generously bestowed upon us. May our lives be a reflection of Your love, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: These verses summarize the core of Christian living. If we love someone the way Christ loves us, we will be willing to forgive. If we have experienced God's grace, we will want to pass it on to others.
subject: Forgive as You've Been Forgiven
verse_text: "Do not plot against your neighbor, for they trust you. Don't make accusations against someone who hasn't wronged you. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Do not envy violent people; don't copy their evil ways. Such

wicked people are an abomination to the Lord, but He offers His 

friendship to the godly. (Pro. 3:31, 32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We should never envy evil people, even though some may be

extremely popular or extremely rich. What an unbeliever gets

on earth may last for a life time, but what you get from following

God will last for eternity.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the many blessing You have showed us with.

I am not rich in earthly treasures, but I am rich when it comes to

family, friends, and Your promise of a home in Heaven with You.

AMEN.
original_reflection_text: We should never envy evil people, even though some may be extremely popular or extremely rich. What an unbeliever gets on earth may last for a life time, but what you get from following God will last for eternity.
original_verse_text: "Do not envy violent people; don't copy their evil ways. Such wicked people are an abomination to the Lord, but He offers His friendship to the godly.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that the ways of the wicked may seem enticing, but their path leads only to ruin. Help us to resist the temptation to envy those who prosper through ungodly means, for their success is fleeting. Instead, grant us the wisdom to seek Your will and to find joy in the eternal blessings that come from walking in Your ways. May our hope be firmly rooted in the promise of Your steadfast love and the assurance of a future that is secure in Your kingdom. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: We should never envy evil people, even though some may be extremely popular or extremely rich. What an unbeliever gets on earth may last for a lifetime, but what you get from following God will last for eternity.
subject: Lasting Riches Beyond This Life
verse_text: "Do not envy violent people; don't copy their evil ways. Such wicked people are an abomination to the Lord, but He offers His friendship to the godly.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"The Lor4d mocks at mockers, but He shows favor to the 

humble. The wise inherit honor but fools are put to shame,"

(Pro. 3:34, 35)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We can be released from our self centered desires by

humbling our selves before God, realizing all we need

is His approval.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would steer me

clear of the seductive attractions of the world, so that I

can clearly see all that God has to offer. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We can be released from our self centered desires by humbling our selves before God, realizing all we need is His approval.
original_verse_text: "The Lor4d mocks at mockers, but He shows favor to the humble. The wise inherit honor but fools are put to shame, "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our true worth comes not from our own accomplishments, but from Your gracious love and approval. Help us to look not only to our own interests, but also to the interests of others, following the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we find true joy and fulfillment in serving You and one another, rather than in selfish ambition or conceit. Lord, grant us the wisdom to walk in Your ways, that we may receive Your favor and be exalted in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: We can be released from our self-centered desires by humbling ourselves before God, realizing all we need is His approval.
subject: Seek God's Approval, Not Self
verse_text: "The Lor4d mocks at mockers, but He shows favor to the humble. The wise inherit honor but fools are put to shame, "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"My children, listen to me. Listen to your father's instruction.

Pay attention and grow wise. (Pro. 4:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Faith in God should be the controlling principle for your

understanding of the world, your attitudes, and your actions.

Trust in God, He will truly make you wise.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the instruction of

Your Word, it is a lamp to my feet, and a light to my path.

By Your Word I have come to faith in Your Son, my Lord

and Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Faith in God should be the controlling principle for your understanding of the world, your attitudes, and your actions. Trust in God, He will truly make you wise.
original_verse_text: "My children, listen to me. Listen to your father's instruction. Pay attention and grow wise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. Direct our paths, that we may walk in Your ways and find the true understanding that comes from You alone. May our faith in You be the foundation upon which we build our lives. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Faith in God should be the controlling principle for your understanding of the world, your attitudes, and your actions. Trust in God; He will truly make you wise.
subject: Wisdom Through Trusting God
verse_text: "My children, listen to me. Listen to your father's instruction. Pay attention and grow wise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"I am giving you good advice, don't turn away from my 

teaching." (Pro. 4:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

One of the greatest responsibilities of parents is to encourage

their children to become wise. Of course, all wisdom comes

from God; parents can only encourage their children to turn

to Him. If your parents never taught you in this way, you can

learn from scriptures and then create a legacy of wisdom as

you teach your children.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to never grow tired of seeking

Your advice. May I always be willing to share what I have

learned with others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: One of the greatest responsibilities of parents is to encourage their children to become wise. Of course, all wisdom comes from God; parents can only encourage their children to turn to Him. If your parents never taught you in this way, you can learn from scriptures and then create a legacy of wisdom as you teach your children.
original_verse_text: "I am giving you good advice, don't turn away from my teaching. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the wisdom that comes from You alone. Guide us to seek Your understanding and discernment, that we may walk in the way of righteousness and find shelter under Your protection. Grant us the wisdom to impart Your truth to the next generation, that they may grow in knowledge and the fear of the Lord. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: One of the greatest responsibilities of parents is to encourage their children to become wise. Of course, all wisdom comes from God; parents can only encourage their children to turn to Him. If your parents never taught you in this way, you can learn from Scriptures and then create a legacy of wisdom as you teach your children.
subject: Cultivate Wisdom in Your Children
verse_text: "I am giving you good advice, don't turn away from my teaching. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"All honor to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, for it is


for His boundless mercy that God has given us the privilege of being


born again." Now we live with a wonderful expectation because 

Jesus Christ rose from the dead. (I Pet. 1:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The term born again refers to spiritual birth (regeneration) the

Holy Spirit's act of bring believers to God's family. Jesus used

the concept of new birth when He explained salvation to

Nicodemus (see John 3).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your boundless mercy

which has given us the privilege of being born again. I thank

You that I now live with a wonderful expectation of being

resurrected from the dead... Amen.
original_reflection_text: The term born again refers to spiritual birth (regeneration) the Holy Spirit's act of bring believers to God's family. Jesus used the concept of new birth when He explained salvation to Nicodemus (see John 3).
original_verse_text: "All honor to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, for it is for His boundless mercy that God has given us the privilege of being born again. " Now we live with a wonderful expectation because Jesus Christ rose from the dead.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the new life You have graciously given us through the power of Your Holy Spirit. We are grateful that, just as Jesus explained to Nicodemus, we have been born again, not of the flesh but of the Spirit, and have become Your beloved children. Lord, may we continually walk in the newness of life, filled with Your Spirit and transformed by Your love. Amen.
reflection: The term "born again" refers to spiritual birth (regeneration), the Holy Spirit's act of bringing believers into God's family. Jesus used the concept of new birth when He explained salvation to Nicodemus (see John 3).
subject: Spiritual Rebirth: New Life in God
verse_text: "All honor to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, for it is for His boundless mercy that God has given us the privilege of being born again. " Now we live with a wonderful expectation because Jesus Christ rose from the dead.

original_content:
HOW DO I KNOW THAT CHRIST HAS RISEN?

What proof have I to give?

He touched my life one blessed day and I begin to live!

How do I know He Left the tomb that morning long ago?

I met Him just this morning, and my heart is still aglow!

How do I know endless life He gained for me that day?

His life within is proof enough of immortality!

How do I know that Christ still lives, rich blessings to impart?

He walks with me along the way and lives within my heart!

HAVE A BLESSED EASTER!
original_reflection_text: HOW DO I KNOW THAT CHRIST HAS RISEN?  What proof have I to give? He touched my life one blessed day and I begin to live! How do I know He Left the tomb that morning long ago? I met Him just this morning, and my heart is still aglow! How do I know endless life He gained for me that day? His life within is proof enough of immortality! nHow do I know that Christ still lives, rich blessings to impart? He walks with me along the way and lives within my heart! HAVE A BLESSED EASTER!
original_verse_text: To them God has chosen to make known among the Gentiles the glorious riches of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that in Your great love, You have raised our Lord Jesus Christ from the dead, that we too may walk in newness of life. May the power of His resurrection be evident in our lives, as Christ dwells within our hearts, filling us with the hope of eternal life. We praise You, O God, for the gift of salvation and the assurance that our Savior lives! Amen.
reflection: HOW DO I KNOW THAT CHRIST HAS RISEN? What proof have I to give? He touched my life one blessed day, and I begin to live! How do I know He left the tomb that morning long ago? I met Him just this morning, and my heart is still aglow! How do I know endless life He gained for me that day? His life within is proof enough of immortality! How do I know that Christ still lives, rich blessings to impart? He walks with me along the way and lives within my heart! Have a blessed Easter!
subject: Risen Christ Walks with You
verse_text: To them God has chosen to make known among the Gentiles the glorious riches of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
